text: that is some RUUUDE lawn decorations.

name: jackparsons
text: In my alternate universe this would be a holiday display.

name: ryabovsky
text: REAL ALT TEXT: The anti-abortion protesters go on the sidewalk, of course.

name: aarongstock
text: If you have anti-abortion protesters, then you also need the escorts in the yellow safety vests.

name: zefiel
text: Mexico City's Hugely overcrowded. While not as much as in Tokyo, everything's designed, to a degree, to save space, and the lawns are usually meant for cars. For us it's like the amerikan driveway to the Garage.

name: neonfreon
text: A comment left by neonfreon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, madnes, science, fosters, equinn2006, TheLoneliestMonkey, Sargasm, DrTommyRocks, smilebuddha, Mastronaut)

name: zefiel
text: I should've clarified this, yes, what i mean with 'the lawn is meant for the cars' is that usually the 'lawn' is basically a driveway, either paved or stoned into the lawn, which yeah, can look sorta bad. And it can only look ghetto by comparison, so we don't mind it much.

name: neonfreon
text: ah ok, i thought you meant you just parked on the grass :P that's not ghetto at all, i retract such prior accusations as I have made

name: odei
text: Most lawns in the UK are paved over too to make more room. It's a shame since it's probably because the owners of the house have two cars, so they're polluting more and blocking rain drainage.

name: aperson
text:
Pat: "You do realise your tacky lawn diorama is blocking rain drainage"

Ray: "Fuck along now!"

name: bjorntd
text: Ray: Fuck You for thinking I can save the world with my lawn.

name: neonfreon
text: blocking the rain drainage?  what? please explain.. are they creating flooding on their property?

name: stayawaystars
text:
not so much blocking as letting the rain wash off the asphalt, bringing all kinds of pollutants with it, instead of just soaking into the ground as it is supposed to.

good call on Pat being pissed about it, aperson.

name: anomalous3
text: This might just be my new favorite strip!

name: zefiel
text: Also, 'Codeine Calendar K ontinued'. Pure Genius. Thank You, Mr. Onstad, for not letting us down. May the chemicals ease your illness until it passes soon.

name: m3funkyb
text: man apparently I'm real tacky

name: andrew_
text: why would Ray bother with things like belts?

name: zefiel
text:
He wouldn't usually but he has a finely tuned dress sense. Read his blog.

/yeah, I'll shut up already.

name: katal
text: This strip is a fine example of "too much of a good thing." Not that I'm complaining, but practically every panel contains gold.

name: omnidope
text: I hope someone more enterprising than myself adds this usage to the Marseillaise Wikipedia entry.

name: never_die
text:
Ray can't think of anything that's a little tacky.
The OBVIOUS answer was plaid on stripes.
NO WAIT

text: Agh, it hurts my eyes just thinking about it.

text: I don't think this will have the desired effect on Envelopé, but it will sure be worth seeing.

name: gothfae
text: The American curl originated in Lakewood, California. That's his Dad's side of the Family. His mom's side is French Catholic Southern gentry dating back to before the Civil War (probably back to the Louisiana Purchase). Ray is many generations removed from being French.

text: All right.

name: rothenbergxxx
text: A comment left by rothenbergxxx was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, Sakana, mortshire, mat4900, mistlethrush, goddam)

name: typo
text: I would like very much to see Envelope's new visage.  Faced with such options, he may not have been able to restrain himself from choosing the tackiest image available.

name: catachresis
text:
I always replace the toilet roll, but my belt doesn't match my shoes. I guess that makes me MEDIUM tacky.

addendum: I don't wear a belt, and I consider shoes optional

name: trollcollins
text:
The mental image of a Sylvia Plath mannequin rolling on toy train tracks into an antique gas oven on the hour fills me with GLEE.

It's like the changing of the guards at Buckingham palace, except . . . demented and literary and awesome.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Man, he needed to hire some kids to run after the Sylvia Plath doll crying "Mommy, NOOOOO!!!"
Then it would have been perfect.

Just sayin'....

name: pettytyrant
text:
when the sylvia plath suicide train plunges her into the oven a giant gray statue clad in black with a Meinkampfe and one gray toe big as a Frisco seal should pop out of the ground

it'd be fitting then to have all the protestors go over to it and dance and stomp on it

two birds, one stone as they say

name: pettytyrant
text:
missed the look after Meinkampfe for "Meinkampfe look"

i tried hard on this one internet

name: leon_sumbitches
text: this sounds like an old feud that I used to have with my old neighbors. they used to call the cops on my parents for no reason(usually something in our yard. cops were pretty much on our side as the neighbors were worse). so on the neighbors side of our house, we put a whole bunch of crap there just to piss them off.

name: stevesperd
text: Hate to break it to you, but you're tacky.

name: neonfreon
text:
When I was about 7, a friend and I smeared muddy handprints all over his neighbor's siding, thinking "they can never prove it was us"

little did we realize that we left little handprints as we had little hands.. and we ended up being forced to go knock on their door, apologize, and then wash their wall.

it seems relevant for some reason

name: steerpike66
text: People who use the word 'classy' in any context are a little tacky.

name: notcool
text: ...in a classy sort of way.

name: rogergs
text:
Ray is confusing two classes of po' folks. The "car parked on lawn" is likely to go together with cinderblocks and empty Ballantine bottles, not an elaborate lawn display.

And if he was seriously keepin' it real he'd have the Skynyrd death plane crashing in flames on the hour, followed by the Rossington Collins Band phoenix rising from the ashes, while Calvin urinates on a little Jeff Gordon car doing donuts around the whole thing.

name: stevesperd
text: How in Gods name is this a 3.8? I want names and numbers.

name: planetidiot
text: I don't get the fork thing, I can't even visualize that.  Is it like picking food up with a fork and then switching hands with the food on the fork?  Why would someone do that?  It isn't tacky, it just doesn't make sense unless they have some sort of magnetic hook hand that can only magnetically hold the fork but can't pick food up very well, and the other arm is stumpy and has no elbow and can't reach their face, requiring this sort of process.

name: neonfreon
text:
here is how it happens:

A right handed man might hold a knife with his right hand and hold the fork with his left hand. He would stab the steak with the fork to hold it in place, and do the cutting with the knife, using his right hand. After cutting, he might then put the knife down, and move his fork to his right hand now that it is loaded and ready to eat on.

i have often struggled with this in my dining experiences, and I do not know the proper way to go about this.

name: gothfae
text:
In the U.S. it's common to hold the steak with your left hand on the fork, holding the meat steady, while you cut with your right (I assume this would be reversed for lefties), as the cut is complete you lay the knife down, and transfer the fork to your dominate hand to eat the meat from it.
In other countries, you never lay down your knife, and you eat from the form with the same hand that steadied the meat for cutting.

name: gouldgonewild
text: I am a lefty, and I know that I, and most lefties I have talked to, do not switch hands like this.

name: gothfae
text: Must be a freaky righty thing.

name: lateadopter
text: I am a righty, and I will be the first to admit that I am insufficiently coordinated to eat with my left hand.  If I were to cut with the knife in my left hand, I would lose a finger or fling food off the plate.  If I did not transfer the fork to the right hand after cutting, I would poke myself in the wrong orifice.  Sad, but true.  Well, true-ish.

name: wehavemagnums
text: You guys are rubbish at eating

name: lateadopter
text: I'm out of practice.  I don't really like... meals.

name: bixschmix
text: Yeah, if there's one thing we Americans are known for, it's not being good at eating.

name: tekende
text: I'm eating right now! I haven't spilled my food or drink or ANYTHING yet! I think I'm doing a pretty good job here. *sniff*

name: alzuna
text: Chubby for doing a good job .

name: achilleselbow
text:
That's because other countries are just classier.

I'm Russian, but I grew up here. My mom yells at me for switching hands all the time. She says it makes me look like I am of low mind.

name: rmj12345
text: Is this Revenge of the Minor Characters Month?

name: puadxe
text:
I sat through a shitty episode of x-files yesterday about this topic, but with a terrible x-files twist. This neighborhood had a human-sized monster that lived beneath the subdivision and if anyone put up any tacky outdoor decoration or had a burnt out light on their porch or didn't cut their lawn or something, the monster would just straight up murder them.
You been watching x-files Onstad?

name: jackparsons
text: Shitty, yes, but redeemed by the head sleazeball being the ceo of a thinly disguised Pier One Imports.

name: lateadopter
text: Will Ray's lawn display make it into Roast Beef's all-time list of important train layouts ?

name: jackparsons
text: Jean Tinguely did this and made it tear itself apart.

name: dasilodavi
text:
Remember the days when a storyline was a special occurrence? Nowadays you can't throw a rock in Palo Alto without hitting a plot point.

I'm not going to rant, but I feel like this bad boy could have been done at panel 3. Or let panels 4 through 6 be Ray thinking of things he finds to be unbearable.

Okay, I'm done. End diatribe.

name: wharfrat
text: never really liked this arc, but has it's momments

name: nigelchaos
text: Rube Goldberg approves.

name: skrizach
text: I give it a five for a Tintin mention.

name: dasilodavi
text: Giving top praise for a cheap reference, that's a LITTLE tacky... no, wait, it's unbearable.

name: sirfrederick
text: Ray speaks out on what is real tacky. Meanwhile, his notch-lapel dinner jacket sits in the wardrobe with the pocket square still tucked in.

name: jhunter
text: Ray is hell of classy. So classy that infringements that your averge man would file under "mild tackiness" become instantly unbearable. It is his blessing -- it is also his curse .

name: hygraed
text: Sylvia Plath's son killing himself has given this strip an extra layer of pathos.
